# Data process



## Greece


### Wave 1


#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `DM` |
|-|-|
| **Label** | `Diabetes Mellitus at baseline`|
| **Table name**  | `ATTICA_Baseline`|
| **Categories** | `1 = Yes; 0 = No` |
| **Description** |  |

```{r assign w1, echo=F}

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'ATTICA_w1','ATTICA.ATTICA_Baseline',variables=list('DM'), missings = T)
ATTICA_w1 <- opal.execute(o,'ATTICA_w1')

```

```{r local w1, echo=F}

vbl <- ATTICA_w1$DM
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = names(ATTICA_w1)[2])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(ATTICA_w1, aes(x=factor(DM))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

```


#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_diabetes` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `keep up 0 into 0`
* `keep up 1 into 1`

Age of diagnosis cannot be harmonized.

**R script:**

```{r harmo w1}

# Categorical variable harmonization
ATTICA_ds_w1 <- tibble(id=ATTICA_w1$id)
ATTICA_ds_w1$h_diabetes <- ATTICA_w1$DM

ATTICA_ds_w1$h_diabetes <- labelled(ATTICA_ds_w1$h_diabetes, labels = cat_label)

```


#### Statistics of the new harmonized variable

```{r descript w1, echo=F}

vbl <- ATTICA_ds_w1$h_diabetes
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label)
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(ATTICA_ds_w1, aes(x=factor(h_diabetes))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")

```


#### Validation

```{r crosstabulation w1, echo=F}

AfterH <- table(ATTICA_ds_w1$h_diabetes)
BeforeH <- table(ATTICA_w1$DM, useNA = "ifany")
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
colnames(C) <- c("0->0","1->1")
kable(C)

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_diabetes` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `DM == 0 and DM5 == 0 into 0`
* `DM == 1 or DM5 == 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `h_diabetes_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_diabetes == 1 in w2 and 0 in w1, h_diabetes_age = age-(year of interview w2-year of interview w1)/2`
* `if h_diabetes == 0, h_diabetes_age = 996`
* `h_diabetes == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo w2}

# Categorical variable harmonization
ATTICA_ds_w2 <- tibble(id=ATTICA_w2$id)

ATTICA_w2 <- left_join(ATTICA_w2, ATTICA_w1, by = "id")
ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes <- rep(999,length(ATTICA_w2$id))
ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes[((!is.na(ATTICA_w2$DM5)) & ATTICA_w2$DM5 == 0) & ((!is.na(ATTICA_w2$DM)) & ATTICA_w2$DM == 0)] <- 0
ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes[((!is.na(ATTICA_w2$DM5)) & ATTICA_w2$DM5 == 1) | ((!is.na(ATTICA_w2$DM)) & (!is.na(ATTICA_w2$DM5)) & ATTICA_w2$DM == 1)] <- 1

ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes <- labelled(ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes, labels = cat_label)

# Continuous variable harmonization
diabetes_age <- ATTICA_w2$age[ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes == 1 & ATTICA_w2$DM==0]-(ATTICA_w2$yintw_w2[ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes == 1 & ATTICA_w2$DM==0]-ATTICA_w2$yintw_w1[ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes == 1 & ATTICA_w2$DM==0])/2

ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes_age <- rep(999,length(ATTICA_w2$id))
ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes_age[ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes == 0] <- 996
ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes_age[ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes == 1 & ATTICA_w2$DM==0] <- diabetes_age

ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes_age <- labelled(ATTICA_ds_w2$h_diabetes_age, labels = cont_label)

```


#### Statistics of the new harmonized variable

```{r descript w2, echo=F}

kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label)

kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")

ggplot(ATTICA_ds_w2, aes(h_diabetes_age)) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label_age) + ylab("Frequency")+xlim(25,85)
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_diabetes` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `DM == 0 and DM5 == 0 and DM10 == 0 into 0`
* `DM == 1 or DM5 == 1 or DM10 == 1 into 1`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `h_diabetes_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_diabetes == 1 in w3 and 0 in w2, h_diabetes_age = age-(year of interview w3-year of interview w2)/2`
* `if h_diabetes == 1 in w3 and w2, h_diabetes_age as in w2`
* `if h_diabetes == 0, h_diabetes_age = 996`
* `h_diabetes == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo w3}

# We use the harmonized variable of wave 2 instead of the study-specific variables from all the previous waves
# Categorical variable harmonization
ATTICA_ds_w3 <- tibble(id=ATTICA_w3$id)

ATTICA_w3 <- left_join(ATTICA_w3, ATTICA_ds_w2, by = "id")
ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes <- rep(999,length(ATTICA_w3$id))
ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes[((!is.na(ATTICA_w3$DM10)) & ATTICA_w3$DM10 == 0) & ((!is.na(ATTICA_w3$h_diabetes)) & ATTICA_w3$h_diabetes == 0)] <- 0
ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes[((!is.na(ATTICA_w3$DM10)) & ATTICA_w3$DM10 == 1) | ((!is.na(ATTICA_w3$h_diabetes)) & (!is.na(ATTICA_w3$DM10)) & ATTICA_w3$h_diabetes == 1)] <- 1

ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes <- labelled(ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes, labels = cat_label)

# Continuous variable harmonization
diabetes_age <- ATTICA_w3$age[ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes == 1 & ATTICA_w3$h_diabetes==0]-(ATTICA_w3$yintw_w3[ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes == 1 & ATTICA_w3$h_diabetes==0]-ATTICA_w3$yintw_w2[ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes == 1 & ATTICA_w3$h_diabetes==0])/2

ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes_age <- rep(999,length(ATTICA_w3$id))
ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes_age[ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes == 0] <- 996
ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes_age[ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes == 1 & ATTICA_w3$h_diabetes==0] <- diabetes_age
ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes_age[ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes == 1 & ATTICA_w3$h_diabetes==1] <- car::recode(ATTICA_w3$h_diabetes_age[ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes == 1 & ATTICA_w3$h_diabetes==1],"miss_values_vector=999")

ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes_age <- labelled(ATTICA_ds_w3$h_diabetes_age, labels = cont_label)

```

<!--AUXILIAR FUNCTIONS-->



```{r helpfunctions, echo=F}


labelling <- function(l.hds,m.hds,vbl_name,ds_lab = ds_label){
  
  # Labelling of the tibbles with categorical data and creating new tibbles with all missings recodified as NA

  for(name in names(l.hds)) {
    if(vbl_name %in% names(l.hds[[name]])){
      # In the aux_object we copy the old tibble to recodify all missing values as NA.
      aux_object <- l.hds[[name]]
      # Labelling of variables
      label(l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]]) <- label(aux_object[[vbl_name]]) <- ds_lab
      # Labelling of categories (for continues variables, only missing values)
      l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]] <- labelled(l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]], labels = cat_label)
      aux_object[[vbl_name]] <- car::recode(aux_object[[vbl_name]], "miss_values_vector=NA")
      # Labelling of categories (for categorical variables, only non-missing values)
      aux_object[[vbl_name]] <- labelled(aux_object[[vbl_name]], labels = cat_label[1:(length(cat_label)-9)])
      # Saving the recodified tibble in list m.hds
      m.hds[[name]] <- aux_object
      rm(aux_object)
    }
  }
  return(list(l.hds,m.hds))

}


labelling_c <- function(l.hds,m.hds,vbl_name,ds_lab=ds_label){
  
  # Labelling of the tibbles with continuous data and creating new tibbles with all missings recodified as NA

  for(name in names(l.hds)) {
    if(vbl_name %in% names(l.hds[[name]])){
      # In the aux_object we copy the old tibble to recodify all missing values as NA.
      aux_object <- m.hds[[name]]
      # Labelling of variables
      label(l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]]) <- label(aux_object[[vbl_name]]) <- ds_lab
      # Labelling of categories (for continues variables, only missing values)
      l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]] <- labelled(l.hds[[name]][[vbl_name]], labels = cont_label)
      aux_object[[vbl_name]] <- car::recode(aux_object[[vbl_name]], "miss_values_vector=NA")
      aux_object[[vbl_name]] <- remove_val_labels(aux_object[[vbl_name]])
      # Saving the recodified tibble in list m.hds
      m.hds[[name]] <- aux_object
      rm(aux_object)
    }
  }
  return(list(l.hds,m.hds))

}


# Creation of summary tables for categorical data

summaries <- function(l.hds,m.hds,lnames,vbl_name){

  # Creation of columns with categories and labels
  t.hds <- frq(l.hds[[1]][vbl_name])[[1]][,c(1,2)] 
  # For each wave/population in l.hds, add the correponding values
  for (i in seq_along(l.hds)){
    t.hds[2+i] <- frq(l.hds[[i]][vbl_name])[[1]][,4] 
  }
  # Add sample size for each wave/population
  t.hds[2+length(cat_label),] <- c("n", "sample size", sapply(l.hds,function(wave) length(wave[[1]]))
  )
  # Add wave/population names
  names(t.hds)<-c("val", "label",lnames)
  return(t.hds)
  
}


# Creation of summary tables for continuous data

summaries_c <- function(l.hds,m.hds,lnames,vbl_name){

  # Creation of column with summary table categories
  t.summ <- summary(m.hds[[1]][vbl_name])[1:6]
  # Adding of missing/no-missing values categories
  t.hds <- c(substr(t.summ,1,regexpr(":", t.summ, fixed=T)-1),labels(Continuous_summary(l.hds[[1]][[vbl_name]], missing_values = miss_values_vector)$values_table)[[2]])
  # For each wave/population in l.hds, add the correponding values
  for (i in seq_along(l.hds)){
    # First, summary values
    t.summ <- summary(m.hds[[i]][vbl_name])[1:6]
    # Next, missing/no-missing values (the 1 in $values_table[1,] stands for absolute values, while a 2 would stand for percentages)
    t.hds <- cbind(t.hds,c(as.numeric(substr(t.summ,regexpr(":", t.summ, fixed=T)+1,nchar(t.summ))),as.numeric(Continuous_summary(l.hds[[i]][[vbl_name]],missing_values = miss_values_vector)$values_table[1,])))
  }
  # Add sample size for each wave/population
  t.hds <- rbind(t.hds,c("sample size", sapply(l.hds,function(wave) length(wave[[1]]))))
  # Add wave/population names
  dimnames(t.hds)[[2]] <- c(dimnames(summary(m.hds[[1]][vbl_name]))[[2]],lnames)
  return(t.hds)
  
}



# Creation of trajectories table for each population

trajectories <- function(m.hds,vbl_name){
  
  # First wave data
  dbb <- m.hds[[1]][,c("id",vbl_name)]
  # Merge with next waves data
  for(ind in 2:length(m.hds)){
    dbb <- merge(dbb, m.hds[[ind]][,c("id",vbl_name)], by = "id", suffixes = c("", paste0(".",names(m.hds)[ind])), all = T)
  }
  names(dbb) <- c("id", names(m.hds))
  
  # Glue individual data through all waves into trajectories
  v.dbb <- dbb[,2]
  for(ind in 2:length(m.hds)){
    v.dbb <- paste(v.dbb,dbb[,ind+1],sep="")
  }
  # Trajectories and frequencies
  f.dbb <- frq(v.dbb)[[1]][,c(1,2,4)]
  return(f.dbb)
  
}

# Save data tables

savingRD <- function(l.hds,vbl_name){
  
  for(index in seq_along(l.hds)){
    assign(vbl_name,l.hds[[index]])
    save(vbl_name,list = vbl_name, file = paste0(datafolder,names(l.hds)[index],"/",vbl_name,".RData"))
  }
  
}

```

<!--Labelling and saving-->

```{r, echo=FALSE}


# Consider only waves with some variable harmonised

l.hds <- lapply(attica.cw, function(wname) if(exists(paste0("ATTICA_ds_",wname[1]))){wname = list(get(paste0("ATTICA_ds_",wname[1])),wname[2])})
nullw <- which(sapply(l.hds, is.null))

if(length(nullw)!=0){
  l.hds <- l.hds[-nullw]
}

m.hds <- list()

lmlist <- list(lapply(l.hds,function(x)x[[1]]),m.hds)

if(length(l.hds)>0){
  # Labelling categorical variable of tibbles
  lmlist <- labelling(lmlist[[1]],lmlist[[2]],hd_vbl,ds_label)
  # Labelling continuous variable of tibbles
  lmlist <- labelling_c(lmlist[[1]],lmlist[[2]],hd_age_vbl,ds_label_age)
  # Saving tibbles
  savingRD(lmlist[[1]],vbl_name=hd_vbl)
}

atticalist <- lmlist # ATTICA list




```




<!--Descriptives-->

## Descriptive statistics of the harmonised variable `h_diabetes` accross populations and waves

Two tables are generated: 

1. Percentages of categories in each harmonised variable.

2. Frequencies and percentages of individuals with different trajectories.

```{r summ, echo=F}


# Consider only harmonised waves
l.hds <- lapply(attica.cw, function(wname) if(hd_vbl %in% names(get0(paste0("ATTICA_ds_",wname[1])))){wname})

nullw <- which(sapply(l.hds, is.null))

if(length(nullw)!=0){
  l.hds <- l.hds[-nullw]
}



if(length(l.hds)>0){
  lmlist[[1]] <- atticalist[[1]][sapply(l.hds,function(x)x[[1]])]
  lmlist[[2]] <- atticalist[[2]][sapply(l.hds,function(x)x[[1]])]
  
  # Printing table of categories
  print(knitr::kable(summaries(lmlist[[1]],lmlist[[2]],lapply(l.hds,function(x)x[[2]]),hd_vbl),caption=ds_label))
  # Printing table of trajectories
  f.dbb <- trajectories(lmlist[[2]],vbl_name=hd_vbl)
  print(knitr::kable(f.dbb))

}



```

# Quality estimation

We assume that if an individual answers it has diabetes in one wave, it has diabetes for all the next waves. Individuals with discrepancies with respect to this criterium are specified at the end of each validation.
